reviews.text: The Hilton Antwerp is a fine hotel in the heart of Antwerp. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The service is first class. Most of all it is located in the heart of Antwerp, one of Europe less known but fascinating and romantic cities. The Hilton is right in the Groenplaats, the city center, and a short walk from the Cathedral of Our Lady. Dozens of fine restaurants are nearby. The shopping center and the diamond market are close as well. The Terrace Cafe is a great place to relax after touring and shopping in this beautiful and enchanting Flemish city.
reviews.title: A great hotel in one of Europe's greatest cities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Antwerp Hilton for one night, on arrival we had an upgrade for the executive floor. We really liked the atmosphere of the hotel, it didn’t felt outdated for us. We had some drinks in the excellent maritime bar. Our room was as expected very good. But our positive feeling changed at 11 pm when very loud music started somewhere in the hotel. I called the reception where I got the confirmation there was a party in the hotel ballroom. The person I got on the phone seemed to be annoyed with the situation and asked if we wanted some earplugs … when I insisted how loud the music was he said he would ask to turn the volume down which actually happened after 10 minutes, I fell asleep but my wife said she still heard some music later in the night. I have to say I was seriously disappointed and I rather felt I was in a 2star hotel somewhere in Ibiza but not in the Hilton. Next day the breakfast was very nice and the personnel at checkout were concerned about what happened last night they did apologize and did a commercial gesture which was very well appreciated. Final (personal) note this is certainly one of the best hotels in Belgium but you can’t give your guests a good night of sleep and organize late parties with loud music in the same hotel it just won’t work.
reviews.title: Good location good staff but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend in the Hilton Antwerp. The hotel itself is in a stunning building. The restaurant and lobby look fantastic but when you get down to the service, there's a lot of room for improvement. We booked the weekend on the Hilton website and got a special weekend deal so when we checked in, we were surprised and pleased to be told by the receptionist that breakfast was included. I asked for the Wi fi password and was told that Wi Fi was charged at €5 per hour or €15 per day. In my experience, the vast majority of hotels in Europe offer free Wi Fi. We didn't avail of the service. The room was fine. During the night, it was oppressively hot and airless and we had to put the air conditioning on to sleep. The bed was reasonably comfortable but the pillows were not. Breakfast was a decent buffet with a good variety but nothing exceptional. When I joined my boyfriend at our table one of the mornings and asked for coffee, the waiter removed an almost empty coffee pot from the table he was clearing and used it to half fill my cup before leaving me the empty pot and disappearing. On checking out, we discovered that the cost of breakfast had been added to our bill after all. We queried this and were told that on no circumstances could this have been included in our rate. After much discussion, the hotel agreed to remove half the charge from the bill as a gesture of good will but we were still left with a bad taste in our mouths. We wouldn't normally bother with breakfast and certainly wouldn't have bothered had we known we'd be charged for it. We left our luggage for a few hours after checking out and when we returned to collect it, I went to use the loo in the lobby before leaving and discovered you had to either use your room card to get in, or contact reception to get them to open it. That's the kind of thing you expect in a cut price establishment, not in a Hilton. We travel to Antwerp a couple of times per year and normally stay in a different hotel in the Diamond district. The location is not so great but service is much nicer and the rooms bigger, roomier and more comfortable for 75% of the cost. The Hilton undoubtedly has the best hotel location in Antwerp but we were both agreed that we wouldn't ever go back there.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel in great location but disappointing service

reviews.text: excellent location at the Groenplaats in the middle of town,100 meters from Our Lady cathedral and old town.breakfast room has a view on the Groenplaats .Elegantly decorated rooms, good service.You can easily combine business and leisure
reviews.title: breakfast with a view

reviews.text: This is a grand dame of a hotel, superb location, huge rooms, with all the facilities one would expect from a Hilton. Getting to the hotel was incredible. I arrived by train, and took a taxi to the hotel. When I saw the number of roads being dug up, I had to almost applaud my driver for his avoidance skills. Once here, I cant think of a better located hotel. Walking distance to everything, including the station as I found out on my way back to the beautiful train station, a wonderful short walk. Staff I encountered were friendly and helpful. It seemed the hotel was very busy on the weekend I was there but they did give me a great room (perhaps because it was so busy, I got lucky). The bed is amazing, and I loved the bar. All in all, a super hotel in a very privileged location.
reviews.title: Location Can't Be Beat, But Getting here.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In principal this hotel has everything going for it - large, comfy rooms and an excellent location close to the nicer, 'old end' of town. Exec rooms aren’t much better than standard rooms but access to the lounge will mean that you get free breakfast/lunch/drinks and the most excellent 5th floor balcony which overlooks the cathedral.
reviews.title: Think twice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, buyers beware! During our visit they had let a function room to a party and the (loud) music went on until midnight despite dozens of complaints. This radiated through one half of the hotel. We shifted rooms but were then unable to have our choice of king size bed - which was a bit of a let down on our anniversary! We were told the hotel was full but it was clear that some of the better rooms were still available ;). We also encountered large groups of smokers blocking the entrance at the weekend, again from another function.
reviews.title: Old Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the weekend the breakfast service is poor. They take away the good stuff like pancakes/sprinkles and when we arrived half an hour before service close there wasn’t a free table available because nobody had bothered to clear tables away. It’s not very nice having breakfast while being sat around rotting food.
reviews.title: Great location, big rooms

reviews.text: Don’t try and complain either. There is no formal procedure other than the room surveys which probably get thrown in the bin. Overall disappointed and bitter – make sure you ask if they have any functions during your stay and then think twice.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

description: Awarded the 2012 Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence, the Hilton Antwerp is an elegant hotel housed in an historic building of architectural importance, in the most central, prime location of any hotel in Antwerp, right on the Groenplaats Square. This luxurious hotel is within walking distance of the finest shopping the city has to offer, the best museums are a brief walk away including the fantastic new MAS, nightlife and fine dining all within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Hotel Facilities include the largest guest rooms in Antwerp with marbled bathrooms (with separate stall showers), Flat Screen TV's, minibar, coffee/tea making facilities, wifi throughout (at a fee), and for those needing that added bit of luxury, the Hilton Antwerp has the only true Executive Floor concept in Antwerp, with a classically elegant lounge and an exclusive outdoor terrace. For meetings and galas, the Hilton Antwerp houses the elegant Belle Epoque Ballroom, the largest hotel ballroom in Belgium along with 11 other flexible and functional meeting rooms. 24 hour rooms service compliments our wonderful Terrace Cafe, Lobby Lounge and Maritime Bar. There is a public Parking Garage with direct lift access to the hotel lobby.
